availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton Beard (Hart County, Kentucky, wood chopper)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, wood chopper. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Beard. Father of Aletha J. Beard, William A. Beard, Margaret L. Beard, and John G. Beard. Resided in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Wood chopper in Hart County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 68. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 49. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 10, p. 10. Find A Grave, "Milton Beard (1813-1884)," Memorial #68029607, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=68029607&ref=acom (accessed June 6, 2017).
